maddison wrote: i think the back cargo is deffo the correct place

After inspecting the old original cargo door off my 65, i found it had 4 pins on the inside of the rear door - which obviously held the badge on in days gone by. So that's where the new one's going, problem solved

Hi Bob!
According to a guy I met who worked in the Devon factory, it was actually Jack's wife who had the 61 made for his birthday. Apparently he thought it was too flash and never actually used it much.
Our 67 Devon has its original badge fixed to the tailgate, below the Volkwagen badge. I've seen a couple of other late Devons with it in the same place, so maybe the factory started putting them there in 66/67? The detailed plastic badge is in the same place on the inside of the passenger door - they kept this location for at least the first three years of Bay conversions.
Just off to choose my next anorak now

My '65 Caravette has a plastic woven type of label attached to the rear RH cargo door with four rivets, one in each corner. The badge has a sort of reflective shimmer effect but it is OG and the paint on the door has faded etc and the metal around the rivets has rusted.

I have just bought an old metal badge from eBay which is brass plated with nickel. The casting has two 1" long pins to go through two holes. It is corroded around the edges and grubby! It has K4040 cast into the back.
EDIT links repaired

My original cargo door fitted badge is the same two pinned K4040 stamped Caravette badge. Club spares make an aluminium replica without the pins.
